label: 大嘗祭
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Also called the Daijō-e.  A Shintō festival held once at the beginning of each reign, being the first Harvest Festival (Niiname-matsuri) after the coronation (sokui) of the new Sovereign (Tennō). [大嘗会、神道、新嘗祭、即位、天皇]
